greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the least k > n such that k*n is a cube.
comment: a(n) <= n^2 for all n > 1 because n * n^2 = n^3.
link: Peter Kagey, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5000
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{k = n + 1}, While[! IntegerQ@ Power[k n, 1/3], k++]; k]; Array[f, 54] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Mar 17 2015 *)
program: (min..n+1).each { |i| return i**3/n if i**3 % n == 0 && i**3 > n**2 }

(PARI) a(n) = {f = factor(n); for (i=1, #f~, if (f[i,2] % 3, f[i,2] = 3 - f[i,2]);); cb = factorback(f); cbr = sqrtnint(cb*n, 3); cb = cbr^3; k = cb/n; while((type(k=cb/n) != "t_INT") || (k<=n), cbr++; cb = cbr^3;); k;} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Mar 14 2015
xref: Cf. A072905 (an analogous sequence for squares).
Cf. A048798 (similar sequence, no restriction that a(n) > n).
results.author: _Peter Kagey_, Feb 07 2015
